definition[0]: to make something bad or unpleasant happen
example[0]: Stress can bring on an asthma attack.
example[1]: What’s brought this on? Have I upset you somehow?
definition[1]: to help someone to improve or make progress
example[2]: Teachers have to bring on the bright children and at the same time give extra help to those who need it.
definition[2]: to make plants or crops grow faster
example[3]: Keeping the young plants in a greenhouse will help bring them on.
definition[3]: used to say that you are prepared and willing to deal with something bad that is likely to happen
